statements: SELECT * FROM Employee_Performance
SELECT name, department FROM Employee_Performance WHERE employee_id = 1
SELECT employee_id, name, performance_rating FROM Employee_Performance ORDER BY performance_rating DESC
SELECT * FROM Employee_Performance WHERE department = 'Sales' AND attendance_status = 'Present'
SELECT employee_id, position FROM Employee_Performance WHERE performance_rating BETWEEN 1 AND 3
SELECT * FROM Employee_Performance WHERE performance_rating > 4 ORDER BY name ASC, department DESC
SELECT name, department, position FROM Employee_Performance WHERE attendance_status = 'Present'
SELECT employee_id, name, position FROM Employee_Performance WHERE department = 'HR' OR department = 'Finance' ORDER BY employee_id DESC
SELECT * FROM Employee_Performance WHERE position LIKE '%Manager%' AND attendance_status = 'Present'
SELECT AVG(performance_rating) AS average_rating, department FROM Employee_Performance GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(employee_id) > 5 ORDER BY average_rating DESC
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, position FROM employees WHERE hire_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT employee_id, check_in, check_out FROM attendance ORDER BY check_in DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE position IN ('Manager', 'Supervisor') ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT name, position, hire_date FROM employees WHERE position = 'Manager';
SELECT employee_id, department FROM employees WHERE hire_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT name, position FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT' ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT * FROM attendance WHERE check_in >= '2022-09-01' AND is_absent = FALSE;
SELECT * FROM Employees LIMIT 5;
SELECT employee_name, department, salary FROM Employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT employee_id, hire_date, department FROM Employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT attendance_date, start_time, end_time, hours_worked FROM Attendance WHERE hours_worked > 8;
SELECT employee_name, performance_id, productivity_score, attendance_score FROM Employees JOIN Performance ON Employees.employee_id = Performance.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM Employees ORDER BY employee_name DESC, salary ASC
SELECT employee_name, department FROM Employees WHERE hire_date > '2022-01-01'
SELECT employee_name, SUM(salary) AS total_salary FROM Employees GROUP BY employee_name
SELECT E.employee_name, A.attendance_date, A.hours_worked FROM Employees E JOIN Attendance A ON E.employee_id = A.employee_id
SELECT P.employee_id, P.productivity_score, P.attendance_score, E.salary FROM Performance P JOIN Employees E ON P.employee_id = E.employee_id
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department, hire_date FROM employees WHERE department = 'Finance';
SELECT employee_id, name, performance_rating FROM employees WHERE performance_rating > 8 ORDER BY performance_rating DESC;
SELECT * FROM attendance WHERE hours_worked > 8;
SELECT department_name, manager_id FROM departments ORDER BY department_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE performance_rating > 3 ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT e.name, d.department_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.department_name;
SELECT e.name, SUM(a.hours_worked) AS total_hours_worked FROM employees e JOIN attendance a ON e.employee_id = a.employee_id GROUP BY e.name;
SELECT AVG(performance_rating) AS avg_rating, department FROM employees GROUP BY department HAVING AVG(performance_rating) > 2;
SELECT * FROM employees LIMIT 5
SELECT employee_name, salary FROM employees WHERE department='HR'
SELECT employee_name, hire_date FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC
SELECT employee_name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000
SELECT department_name, manager_name FROM departments INNER JOIN managers ON departments.manager_id = managers.manager_id
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY salary DESC, hire_date ASC
SELECT employee_name, department, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 AND department = 'HR'
SELECT employee_name, department, hire_date, rating FROM employees e JOIN performance_rating p ON e.employee_id = p.employee_id WHERE p.rating > 4
SELECT e.employee_name, d.department_name, m.manager_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.department_name JOIN managers m ON d.manager_id = m.manager_id
SELECT department_name, COUNT(employee_id) AS employee_count FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.department_name GROUP BY department_name ORDER BY employee_count DESC
